results.title: ABZÛ
results.brief_description: ABZÛ is an exploration game where you are a lone diver in a lush ocean world. The diver descends deeper and deeper into the depths, where she will encounter majestic creatures, discover ancient secrets, and search for her true purpose.

constellations_other.name: Deep blue
constellations_other.description: Go deep on an exploration of real world oceans and those rendered by pixels and creatures made from plastics.

results.title: Abuelas
results.creator_credit: Afarin Eghbal, Kasia Malipan and National Film and Television School (Great Britain)
results.brief_description:
Between 1976 and 1983 Argentina was under a military regime that launched a campaign of terror (now known as the ‘Dirty War’) in which 30,000 people ‘disappeared’.
Among them were children and pregnant women. An estimated 500 babies were born in concentration camps. Whilst the mothers were killed, the children were adopted out, in many cases to military families.
For over 30 years, the ‘Las Abuelas de Plaza de la Mayo’ (‘Grandmothers of the Plaza de Mayo’) have been campaigning to recover these lost grandchildren. Since 2011 over 100 have been found and regained their true identities.
The Abuelas continue to search for the rest.

results.title: Abstraction
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “The Painter’s world: changing constants of art from the Renaissance to the present”.
20th century art has been dominated by Abstraction which could be said to be its legacy to art. This program traces the antecedents of Abstraction in the nineteenth and early twentieth centuries, and then goes on to explore the work of notable Abstractionists, such as Miro, Kandinsky, Mondrian, Barnett Newman, Pollock, Rothko, and Frank Stella, stressing the risk taking aspects of this form of art, and dividing it into two main strands - the geometric and analytic, and that inspired by organic life.

results.title: Abstraction
results.creator_credit: American Federation of Arts, ACI Films and Films Incorporated
results.brief_description: Shows that abstraction is an essential aspect of daily living. Uses a variety of examples to establish a definition of abstraction and to illustrate how the artist employs it when selecting what is visually and emotionally significant in the creation of their work.

results.title: Abstract in concrete (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: John Arvonio and John Arvonio Productions
results.brief_description: An experimental film produced by photographing neon signs in the wet pavements of Times Square New York. This unusual film was painstakingly photographed on rainy nights, under difficult conditions, over a period of five years. The producer has discovered, and recorded, a wealth of visual beauty in the patterns and movements of the constantly changing light reflections.

results.title: Abstract designs from nature with Edward Betts
results.brief_description: Observes Edward Betts as he makes several pencil drawings at a quarry. Shows how he develops one of his drawings into a watercolour in his studio.

results.title: Absolution
results.creator_credit: Andrew Lawrence, Tor Larson and AFTRS
results.brief_description: A questioning of religious beliefs and values as seen through the eyes of 11-year-old Malcolm, an altar boy. Malcolm lives with his mother and younger brother in a caravan and earns himself a bit of pocket money by doing jobs and helping out his elderly neighbour, Poppy. When Poppy suffers a stroke, Malcolm is faced with the dubious motives of his own mother and Poppy’s son Charles who is trying to find the Deed Box containing Poppy’s family papers and documents. Malcolm’s ultimate intervention achieves a kind of absolution for them all. Cast includes Malcolm Roberts (as Malcolm), Kim Dawson, Edward Primrose, Cathleen Cooper, Eli Roberts.

results.title: Absolutely fabulous: the last shout. Parts 1 & 2
results.creator_credit: Bob Spiers, Jon Plowman, Janice Thomas, BBC and Saunders and French
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Absolutely fabulous”.
Absolutely fabulous, the popular British comedy series, conceived by Jennifer Saunders and Dawn French, is a hilarious satire that plays with elements of the absurd and high camp, set in the cutting edge world of fashion design. Episode “The Last shout” - parts one and two. Part one: Eddie has adopted a dolphin that she is using to cleanse her aura and assist her in losing weight. Having vacated her room above the bottle shop, Patsy is homeless and turns to Eddie for support. The pair decide to head off on a skiing holiday where Eddie has a near-death experience and a chat with God (Marianne Faithful) about fashion. Meanwhile, Saffie has become engaged to an over bearing poser, Paolo. Part two: Eddie’s near death experience has left her questioning her existence and she is operating in an altered state. Saffie starts to fold under the pressures of organising the wedding, and suffers from pre-nuptial jitters. Paolo’s parents arrive to meet Eddie, who upon discovering that they are from an important and rich family, seeks to impress them with her charms, causing disaster all round. Cast also includes Joanna Lumley, Julia Sawalha, June Whitfield.

results.title: Absolutely fabulous. Series 3
results.creator_credit: Bob Spiers, Jon Plowman, BBC and Saunders and French
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Absolutely fabulous”.
Three episodes from series 3 of the popular British comedy series, “Absolutely fabulous”, a hilarious satire, set in the London fashion world, that plays with elements of the absurd and high camp. “Door handle”: In need of an overhaul, Eddie sets about getting fit, renovating the kitchen and uses an electronic organiser to get her life in order. Meanwhile, Patsy is concerned for her health and turns to Saffie for advice. In a desperate search for the perfect door handle, the pair fly to New York. “Happy new year”: Eddie decides that her New Year’s Eve resolution is to have more fun. Hence, she and Patsy plan a night on the tiles. Much to Eddie’s chagrin, Patsy’s glamorous and estranged sister joins them. “Sex”: Eddie and Patsy reminisce about their wild sexual exploits in the 1960s and 70s; Eddie determines to get in touch with her sexual side by hiring a male prostitute. Saffie and her study group prepare their genetics and ethics lecture.
